moves.1. Nf3: As usual I prefer e4, but it's always funny to try something new
moves.1... f5: Dutch defence I think. I'm not sure it's appropriate answer to 1.Nf3
moves.2. e3 Nf6 3. d4 e6 4. Bd3 b6 5. c4: Does the game turn to a general dutch variation?
moves.8. O-O: The development of White is finished now
moves.8... Bb7: It was time for Black to fianchetting
moves.9. d5: This move breaks Black center, delays it's castling and in my opinion gives a big advantage for White. The battle starts and Black hasn't many ways to answer.
moves.9... exd5 10. Bxf5 dxc4 11. Nxc4 O-O: Almost all of white's pieces are active and hold the center of the board. Black has an nonactive Q-Knight, poor pawn structure and unpleasant opened diagonal a2-g8
moves.14... Qc6 15. e4 Re8: ...d5 is better - would close the diagonal a2-g8 and would give a chance to consolidate
moves.16. Ne5: Now Black has no choice - its' Queen is trapped and the Knight on e5 must be taken.
moves.16... dxe5: The following combination is very popular from ages
